skills.name: HTML
skills.paragraph: I have a lot experience working with HTML. I am very good at writing correct tag for every part of my code and also when I should give the elements an id or class, fx when single tag should give it an id or more than one tag at the same give them a class. I am trying to use Bootstrap for all of my websites and make them more responsive.

skills.name: CSS
skills.paragraph: in CSS I have experience working with SASS/SCSS, flexbox , animation , and also how to create variable and mixing in sass.I have used CSS in mostly all of my project, but most of them are written in sass and I compiles them to CSS.I use flexbox because of how easy it is and it is automatically responsive.

skills.name: JavaScript
skills.paragraph: in javascript programing language I have experience, with building apps like todo app , working with JSON files, ajax,promises and also using ES2015/ES6 that is a new future in Javascript.I have learned all of these in HackyourFuture that is a programming school in Denmark Copenhagen.HYF in future class we will learn Node, react, express, and databases.

skills.name: C#
skills.paragraph: my experience with C# is that I have completed some exercises that I get from my school(TEC), and because of I new javascript and how to program the excesses I completed them so faster than the other.

skills.name: Node
skills.paragraph: node, I know how to create a server and use switch statement or express to combine many HTML pages together and also how to get querySelector.I have also learned how to use JSON files and promises within node js.in my GitHub account, you can have a look at my node projects.now that is 27/3/2018 we have one week left with node class in Hack Your Future after that we will learn about databases.

skills.name: adobe
skills.paragraph: my experience with Photoshop CC is designing websites. the first portfolio that I built for like 6 month ago I designed it first in adobe and then I started to build it, in that way I knew what I want to build already and also maybe I find something that was better than the design so I used it.

skills.name: LogoDesign
skills.paragraph: I designed a logo for my first portfolio and learned how to use Adobe Illustrator and also how to create a pie chart in Adobe Illustrator.

skills.name: Designwebsite
skills.paragraph: when I create a website I use both Adobe Photoshop cc and Illustrator for designing the website the best way that's possible.

profiles.name: TreeHouse
profiles.paragraph: treehouse has helped me so much in understanding javascript and node. now that I take the full-stack Javascript course I learn so much from it and every day I become learn new concepts.

profiles.name: Udemy
profiles.paragraph: udemy was also a very good learning resource for me, I always took the free courses like jquery or sass. also, I took those courses that I couldn't find in a treehouse like more advanced jquery or SVG courses.

profiles.name: CodeCademy
profiles.paragraph: in the start of my learning progress, I used mostly CodeCademy to learn HTML CSS and designing webs.you can see that I have completed most of the free courses on CodeCademy.

profiles.name: FreeCodeCamp
profiles.paragraph: FreeCodeCamp helps me to understand coding and also I learn about algorithms and the way that I can code correctly.and when a complete an excessive I get a very good feeling that I can ever describe.

profiles.name: KhanAcademy
profiles.paragraph: from KhanAcademy I learned some basic HTML and CSS and also a little about CSS Animation.

profiles.name: Github
profiles.paragraph: GitHub page includes most of my projects and it includes HTML/CSS, C#, javascript and node projects.there are more websites in my GitHub profile because I love development.

profiles.name: Heroku
profiles.paragraph: GitHub page includes most of my projects and it includes HTML/CSS, C#, javascript and node projects.there are more websites in my GitHub profile because I love development.
